001package com.github.nradov.abnffuzzer;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.net.URISyntaxException;
005import java.util.Collections;
006import java.util.HashSet;
007import java.util.Set;
008
009import javax.mail.internet.AddressException;
010import javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress;
011
012import org.junit.Test;
013
014/**
015 * Test the {@link InternetAddress} class.
016 *
017 * @author Nick Radov
018 */
019public class InternetAddressTest {
020
021        @SuppressWarnings("serial")
022        private static final Set<String> EXCLUDE_2822 = Collections.unmodifiableSet(new HashSet<String>() {
023                {
024                        add("CFWS");
025                        add("comment");
026                        add("quoted-string");
027                        add("obs-local-part");
028                }
029        });
030
031        @Test
032    public void testInternetAddress()
033            throws URISyntaxException, IOException, AddressException {
034        final Fuzzer rfc2822 = new Fuzzer(
035                this.getClass().getResourceAsStream("/rfc2822.txt"));
036        final Fuzzer rfc1034 = new Fuzzer(
037                        this.getClass().getResourceAsStream("/rfc1034.txt"));
038
039        for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++) {
040            final String localPart = rfc2822.generateAscii("local-part",
041                    EXCLUDE_2822);
042            final String domain = rfc1034.generateAscii("domain").trim();
043            if (domain.isEmpty()) {
044                // legal but not supported
045                continue;
046            }
047            final InternetAddress addr = new InternetAddress(
048                    localPart + "@" + domain, true);
049            addr.validate();
050        }
051    }
052
053}
